text:
Are you posts tagged? Maybe that's why youre getting nothing in return.

```{% related_blog_posts blog_ids="1,2", limit=5, tags="Sales enablement, couches", end_date="2018-04-10", blog_authors="John Smith,Joe Smith,Frank Smith", path_prefixes="/path-prefix", post_formatter="test_macro" %}```
e.g. *tags=" "*
```{% related_blog_posts blog_ids="1,2", limit=5, tags="Sales enablement, couches" %}```
I want to create opening and closing HTML code for an email and simply have a drag and drop template call the extend
No matter which way I turn, there's a restriction to simply creating my own opening and closing code in conjunction with the drag and drop editor.
Am I going crazy?
If you are talking about the drag n drop email beta, you cant create templates for that yet, but you can for non beta emails
I'm talking about the current Design Tools section

Right. Im saying you cannot create templates in there for the DND beta yet.

As far as extends there is no "extend" in hubl as far as im aware. There is also no child theme support. For now if you have to do it that way you could clone the template.

You can have partials using includes. I havent tried using them in emails though
Doesn't seem to be much robust documentation on how to make a complex email with more fine control over the codebase. Maybe that's just me?

That's mostly you. The hubl docs are what you should look at.

You have near full control over the code if you choose to. I say near because like all ESPs they require CANSPAM tags to be in the code somewhere.

Well so far HubSpot's injected code has messed up one template!

Sorry if I'm not being clear but is there a best practice for outputting exactly the code I wrote while allowing the user to drag and drop modules when building a template (not drag and drop email builder btw)
I tried creating two modules with opening and closing code but HubSpot doesn't seem to like this. Do I need to create a rich text field and call the code in the module using ```{{module.html}}```?

I think you should first try the free course for cms developers. While its not email specific, i think there are fundamental HubSpot specific concepts you dont yet know about.

Regarding the code if you use a coded template you have near full control. Create custom modules for most marketer editable functionality.
And then my customer can create new templates by dragging in modules in Design Tools?
No
Right! That's the issue then. No worries, another email builder that doesn't consider coding professionals! Thanks for your help Jon :slightly_smiling_face:

The design manager is intended for your use. If you want to give them a drag n drop editor you could build in the drag n drop template builder but you do not control the structure code only the code of your modules and css styles.

The drag n drop beta i keep mentioning is that drag n drop feature intended for the marketers. That feature is not yet possible to create templates for
They do consider coders thats why you create coded templates instead

They also are building that drag and drop feature you want for your marketers thats litterally what the beta is.

Also you can use a custom module and a coded template to provide that drag n dropability if you absolutely have to have it but it will be a bit of work
Gotcha, ok I'll have to stay patient and build out some custom coded templates instead then!
<@UECV6AFCM> sorry -- didn't see you response here. Are you still having issues with this?
